title: Classic Italian Recipes Made Easy in the Instant Pot
description: Check out these top-rated recipes for classic Italian dinners, like lasagna, Marsala, saltimbocca, chicken cacciatore, puttanesca, and much more, all made in the Instant Pot.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE 13 Classic Italian Recipes Made Easy in the Instant Pot By Carl Hanson Carl Hanson Carl Hanson is a Senior Editor at Allrecipes who has been writing about food and wine for nearly 20 years. He enjoys creating content that informs, entertains, and assists busy home cooks get nourishing meals on the table for their families. Allrecipes' editorial guidelines Updated on October 12, 2021 Close Photo by France C. Credits: France Cevallos These quick meals pair up some of our favorite Italian recipes with our favorite cooking contraption, the Instant Pot®. Why do we love the Instant Pot? Well, FestivelySouthern, who submitted the Minestrone recipe featured here, gets right to it: "I am amazed at the way the flavors are locked in and how quickly the meals are finished...not to say the super easy clean up." Yes, the Instant Pot offers a triple whammy of speed, concentrated deliciousness, and easy clean-up. See what it does for these top-rated Italian classics, like lasagna, Marsala, saltimbocca, cacciatore, puttanesca, and much more. 01 of 13 Instant Pot® Lasagna View Recipe Save Shauna James Ahern A layered lasagna with tomato sauce, ground beef, fresh spinach, and cheeses comes together quick and easy in the Instant Pot. "You might feel like making lasagna in a pressure cooker is crazy. Don't you need an oven for those crunchy edges? To make sure the meat is cooked through? How can anyone make lasagna without baking it? Well, trust us," says Shauna James Ahern. "This lasagna is well worth making. If you have a 6- or 7-inch springform pan and you kept the trivet that came with your Instant Pot, you can make a delicious layered lasagna pie in 30 minutes. And if you want to make it ahead, you can prep the lasagna, put it in the freezer, then put it right into the Instant Pot for an easy dinner." 02 of 13 Instant Pot® Shrimp Risotto with Peas View Recipe Save lutzflcat "If you love risotto but hate all of the stirring and time involved, you'll love making it in the Instant Pot," says lutzflcat. "You'll have creamy, tender risotto, and adding some shrimp turns this into one delicious main course. Top with an additional sprinkle of Parmesan, if desired." 03 of 13 Instant Pot® Tuna Puttanesca View Recipe Save thedailygourmet Use your Instant Pot to turn frozen tuna steak and some basic pantry ingredients into tuna puttanesca. "Nana's Tuna Puttanesca Sauce with Spaghetti Pasta has long been a favorite dish of mine, and one I regularly turned to when I had canned tuna, but this time when the craving hit, I only had frozen tuna steak," says thedailygourmet. "Instant Pot to the rescue! I chose to cook my pasta separately from the sauce. Serve with crusty bread, if desired." 04 of 13 Instant Pot® Linguine with Pesto and Peas View Recipe Save fabeverydayblog Combine linguine with ricotta, pesto, and peas for a quick pasta dinner that's ready in 35 minutes. "This is a deliciously easy pasta dish made in the Instant Pot®!" says peloquinswife. 05 of 13 Instant Pot® Chicken Saltimbocca View Recipe Save My Hot Southern Mess Here's a twist on the classic saltimbocca recipe, made with chicken breasts in the Instant Pot. It also features fresh sage, prosciutto, and mozzarella cheese. 06 of 13 Instant Pot® Chicken Cacciatore View Recipe Save France C "This wonderful, traditionally slow-cooked recipe has been translated into a quick and easy pressure cooker meal," says Diana71. "Using the Instant Pot®, you get an intensely flavorful meal made in minutes that will have your family thinking you simmered this all day. Serve over spaghetti noodles, rice, cauliflower rice, or eat as a stew!" Kirby1kat rates it 5 stars: "Flavors meld together like they've been simmering all day in a fraction of the time. A couple of small changes: I season the chicken prior to sauteeing." 07 of 13 Instant Pot® Tomato and Beef Sauce View Recipe Save Buckwheat Queen No need to simmer your meat sauce for hours on end when you have an Instant Pot! "Tomato and ground beef sauce with a hint of wine for your pasta," says Bren. "I've made this fairly basic but feel free to adjust the seasoning to your tastes." 08 of 13 Risotto con Zafferano e Pancetta in Pentola a Pressione (Saffron and Pancetta Risotto) View Recipe Save Howard Fragrant saffron plays a starring role in this simple, yet tasty risotto finished with pancetta, Parmesan cheese, and butter. "I ve always been skeptical of cooking risotto in a pressure cooker," says Buckwheat Queen, who rated the recipe 5 stars. "We make risotto--the traditional way--at least three times a week. After seeing this in the Jan 2018 magazine I decided to give it a try. It really works." 09 of 13 Instant Pot® Polenta View Recipe Save Kim's Cooking Now Polenta in the Instant Pot? Believe it! "Polenta, a staple of Northern Italian cuisine, is traditionally made by adding cornmeal to boiling salted water and stirring with a wooden spoon until your biceps ache! You can achieve the same results by letting your Instant Pot do all of the work for you!" says Kim's Cooking Now. "We like to serve this topped with browned Italian sausage and pork ribs that have simmered in a sauce made with onions, garlic, basil and tomato sauce until the ribs are falling-off-the-bone tender! Serve with additional cheese, if desired. Delizioso!" 10 of 13 Instant Pot® Chicken Marsala View Recipe Save thedailygourmet This chicken Marsala recipe uses the Instant Pot's saute function to create moist chicken breasts in a rich Marsala wine and mushroom sauce. "It was quick easy and quite tasty," says Gonzo. "This will be made many times in the future!" 11 of 13 Hearty Minestrone Soup (Instant Pot®) View Recipe Save Festively Southern This quick, hearty minestrone features beef stew meat, tons of veggies, and pasta. "Amazing soup!" raves lutzflcat. "I was able to substitute frozen soup veggies with no problems. This will be a family favorite!" 12 of 13 Instant Pot® Pasta Bolognese View Recipe Save Eric Gross Traditional Bolognese meat sauce is simmered long and slow for several hours. The Instant Pot cuts the cooking time down to 50 minutes. It's "pasta Bolognese that's easy to make and feeds a family," says Eric Gross. 13 of 13 Instant Pot® Pasta with Italian Sausage View Recipe Save Soup Loving Nicole Another super-simple pasta and sauce recipes! Here, Italian-style chicken sausage, bell peppers, tomato sauce, and penne pasta combine in the Instant Pot. "Easy to throw it all together and let it cook," says Tammy Doerr.
